bibl.author: Perry, James
bibl.title: Mimosa: or, The sensitive plant; A poem. Dedicated to Mr. Banks, and addressed to Kitt Frederick, Dutchess of Queensberry, Elect.
bibl.pubPlace: The second edition, with additions. London, 1779. Eighteenth Century Collections Online. Gale. University of Pittsburgh Libraries
bibl.note: it's an interesting poem, and we are looking for literature so this one is apprpriate for the assigment. Search mimosa, poem. only 2 hits for this one. try searching pendicles, effence. not much comes up.

bibl.author: Alexander, William (d. 1783)
bibl.title: The history of women, from the earliest antiquity, to the present time; giving some account of almost every interesting particular concerning that sex, among all nations, ancient and modern. By William Alexander, M.D. In two volumes.
bibl.editor: London : printed for W. Strahan, and T. Cadell, in the Strand, MDCCLXXIX. [1779].
bibl.note: The term Otaheite found references to Otaheite. This helped find a voyage logs of when Otaheite was mentioned. Also the date range from 1750-1790 narrowed the search to the date range that Captain Wallis's voyages were documented.

listbibl.notes: I wasn't sure about this one but volume 2 seems like it could be usuful. 8 hits. Search wiht author, and the place.

bibl.author: Fitzgerald, Gerald.
bibl.title: The injured islanders; or, the influence of art upon the happiness of nature.
bibl.pubPlace: London, MDCCLXXIX. [1779]. Eighteenth Century Collections Online. Gale. University of Pittsburgh Libraries
bibl.author: Fitzgerald, Gerald.
bibl.note: it might be useful to us because it describes nature in Tahiti and we are looking for such things. 4 hits. Search Earfe, gardenia's die, bluphing, these terms were not succesful, but im note sure what others to do, nothing really comes up. i might be doing something wron, hence the reason i asked to meet for help.
